body_html:
I would say this is expected behavior. One of the key features of estimator is that it performs graph and session management for you. So what you've done is you've created a tensor in the default graph (implicitly when you create self.dataset). However model_fn is called within estimator, using the estimator's graph. So you're trying to create a tensor in one graph that depends on another graph which is not allowed. The fact that is worked before is a bug in 1.8 I believe, rather than vice versa.

Thanks for submitting, and for providing a lovely minimal example.

body:
I would say this is expected behavior. One of the key features of estimator is that it performs graph and session management for you. So what you've done is you've created a tensor in the default graph (implicitly when you create self.dataset). However model_fn is called within estimator, using the estimator's graph. So you're trying to create a tensor in one graph that depends on another graph which is not allowed. The fact that is worked before is a bug in 1.8 I believe, rather than vice versa. 

Thanks for submitting, and for providing a lovely minimal example.
